website_summaries.verdict: Offers smooth, quiet keystrokes and a durable build for a reasonable price. If Microsoft is your brand and your are on a budget, it's worth considering.
pros: Boasts a classic build that's easy to use
Keys are quiet, and have a matte finish that resists fingerprints and dust
Components have a durable feel, and the combo comes at a decent price
cons: Insert button on the keyboard is easy to hit by mistake

customer_reviews.title: Silent, ergonomic, and the best freakin' keyboard & mouse set!
customer_reviews.text: Love this wireless mouse & keyboard set. I had it originally at a previous job and when I set out on my own, I had to get the same one for my new home office. It is completely silent - no annoying typing noises!!! The keys are almost flat to the keyboard, similar to a laptop keyboard. The footer kickstands give just the right amount of lift for typing comfortably. The mouse is one of the larger computer mice I've used (I have small hands, lol), but it fits comfortably had a solid-feeling weight to it that I really enjoy. It makes for very smooth movements. Couldn't recommend this set enough. :)
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Only for Perfect Typers
customer_reviews.text: These look great, and I really liked the media buttons, and the price. But... I don't like how short the key press is, and the backspace button on mine does not seem to work well, which makes it a real pain to use since I have to double check that it worked every time I use it which really messes up my flow. I checked to see if something was under the key, but could shake anything loose. I must just have a bad one, but it was so cheap Im not going to bother replacing it, or sending it back. Just switched back to my previous wired keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Moreno II

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wireless keyboard and mouse I was able to find online. I searched dozens from different brands and decided to go with Microsoft. I am using these with my Windows 10 PC that I built myself and they work flawlessly. It was practically plug and play, but I did download the additional Microsoft app to customize the keyboard and mouse buttons. I still have an original wireless keyboard and mouse from Microsoft (PS/2 & USB connection) from my other PC and it still works with Windows 10. They keyboard and mouse are lite and easily moveable anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard and Mouse...Until the USB dongle fails!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 4 of these keyboard/mouse devices over the past couple of years. They are very nice and work well, BUT... After about 9 months, the USB dongle begins to fail and randomly disconnects and re-connects to my laptop. I've had 3 of the 4 I've owned fail, (just put #4 into service today). Used them on 3 different computers so I know it's not a computer issue. They are low cost, so I keep a spare new one on hand and will keep returning them for replacement every time they fail. Not a bad deal really, a free new keyboard and mouse every 9 months! Maybe MS should do better on their quality though....
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely terrible about dropping the connection to the receiver!!! I ended up with the receiver being less than 3 FEET, and it still dropped constantly!!!! Ridiculous! Unfortunately, I discovered this too late to return it. It's so bad, I won't even keep it as a back-up. It is literally going in the trash!!
customer_reviews.author: KiBrDaSoLe

customer_reviews.title: Key Characters Wore Off Quickly
customer_reviews.text: We've had this keyboard for about six months and already we've lost the letters on the A and L keys, with the K key fading fast along with the ">" key, which is also the period key. The problem is with the way the letters/numbers are cheaply applied these days. Same thing has happened with other MS and Logitech wireless keyboards. I guess the manufacturers consider them disposable accessories because of the relatively low prices. No idea which keyboard we'll buy next.
customer_reviews.author: DaffyD

customer_reviews.title: Beware - There is no replacement usb "dongle" available!
customer_reviews.text: I lost the usb "dongle" receiver for this wireless keyboard/mouse set. After searching the internet, I finally called Microsoft. They told me that "unfortunately" they do not have replacement dongles! So now I'm sunk; I will have to buy a new keyboard and mouse. You can bet that it will not be Microsoft!
customer_reviews.author: quiettime

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase in many years.
customer_reviews.text: The dongle for this set broke the second time I removed it from my USB port. You CANNOT buy a replacement, I was told by Microsoft, and they considered the fact that I removed the transceiver from my computer to be a form of misuse. So, I just lost $32 to Microsoft. I feel like I just dealt with a guy selling watches on the corner. Stunned by the lack of support now by the company. I'm upset enough I'm going to do my best -- and it isn't easy -- to avoid purchasing any Microsoft product ever again for my business or personal use.
customer_reviews.author: bob nelson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed without spending a bunch of money
customer_reviews.text: Put in batteries (come with the goods), stick USB stick in (there's just one dongle for both so you're not taking up a 2nd port) and within moments, both the mouse and the keyboard are functional. Easy peasy. Mouse is nice and smooth to use, even on a padless surface and scroller is quiet. Keyboard has feet to prop up just a bit and the keys don't make noise. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ash S.

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard and mouse randomly lag!
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this as it tends to lag randomly (both the keyboard and the mouse). Pulling the USB dongle and reinserting sometimes helped, but minutes later it would lag again. I also was using brand new batteries. Considering the number of reviews I seen regarding lagging for a wide range of bluetooth keyboards/mice, I'm just going back to reliable USB. My wife has had better luck with whatever brand keyboard she has, but I'm not into rose-gold pink.
customer_reviews.author: Brent W

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for a short while - now Nothing??
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened but my mouse and keyboard are no longer working. I have tried unplugging and re-plugging them in multiple times, restarting my lap top etc. and nothing. The batteries are working in both the mouse and keyboard but for some reason I can't use the keyboard or the mouse Having to use the touch pad on my Lap Top. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: SRS

customer_reviews.title: Near full size.  Semi sculptured keys.  Uses a usb port.
customer_reviews.text: Consistently comes up on startup. I would like full size, this is a slight bit smaller, but close. I miss the back lighted keys. When I find a full sized, sculpted key, bluetooth keyboard I am all in. Requirement of USB port means I only use this at home on a docking station. I had no use for the mouse and do not know where I tossed it. I have a logitech bluetooth mouse purchased from Amazon which is excellent and does not rob a port.
customer_reviews.author: L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Keyboard and Mouse Combo that is Quiet and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've used this keyboard and mouse combo for a few weeks now and really enjoy working on it. It's comfortable to use, quiet to type on and the USB receiver encrypts all your keystrokes for added security. What's not to love! Windows users get additional software to control the hotkeys and further customize other functionality here, but it's not required to be honest. If you're happy with how it works out of the box, don't bother installing additional software on your PC. I use this with Windows 10, but I'm certain it should work for Mac and Linux users too. It's just a keyboard and mouse, after all.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Worked for almost 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard, and the mouse was okay. I liked that they use the same USB receiver because I have limited USB ports on my computer. Just before the 2-year mark, the mouse stopped clicking properly. I contacted Microsoft for a warranty claim and they just sent me around in circles which was pretty frustrating. It is supposed to have a 3-year warranty, but the process is so frustrating and time-consuming you would be better off just buying a new one. Sad day.
customer_reviews.author: Sararah

customer_reviews.title: Item was open box and didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have bought tons of these keyboard and mouse combos and never had an issue, until now. They won't connect to the USB dongle. I believe this was open box even though it should have been new, there was tape covering the tape that the manufacturer puts on the box and the batteries were installed, I have never received a cordless keyboard or mouse that has the batteries already installed. No manufacturer would ever leave batteries in a device like this, especially when they don't know how long it will sit on a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Will W

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give this a 1 star but decided on 3 because the return was so easy. I ordered 2 of these keyboards around the same time and they both stopped working within a week. I tried to change out the batteries, check the connections but nothing helped. I ordered another one after returning the 2 and it seems to be working for the moment. Perhaps it was a bad batch of them? On a positive note, I really appreciate how easy it was to return.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Small Keys, Otherwise Works.
customer_reviews.text: Great for tight spaces, it has a small footprint. If I were using it for a media center it would be perfect. I picked this up when my Logitech K800 died after 6 months of use and didn't want to give Logitech any more money. If you have small hands this keyboard might be great for you. I have big hands and I am a developer, so I type a lot. The thing that eventually made me write this review was the fact that the keyboard is so tight that I keep hitting "Insert" instead of backspace, and don't notice it until I've destroyed a few lines of code. Otherwise works great, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. P.

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a nice tactile feel, while still maintaining a low profile design, both of which I love, but rarely found together. I'm considering buying a few more in the event this design is ever retired. The fact that it comes with a wireless mouse as well is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: phusion

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have always preferred Microsoft keyboards and mice. This is replacing an older setup that was still working fine, but needed to be upgraded. I've never quite felt a keyboard this comfortable, it's difficult to describe how the keys feel. They are solid but also sort of soft at the same time. I also find the keys to be much quieter, which isn't a selling point for me but could be for others. The mouse is just as good, no complaints with it, I'm very happy that I spent a few dollars more for this setup
customer_reviews.author: R. Huttner

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has nice flat keys and is easy to type on, but there are many flaws in the design. There is no space between the Backspace key and the Insert key which leads to typing errors and turning on the Insert function (which I have never found useful). Also there is obvious way to "wake up" the keyboard besides removing the batteries and reinserting them. The mouse was much larger than I expected, about 50% bigger than the MS 3500.
customer_reviews.author: Emily C

customer_reviews.title: Not great for me
customer_reviews.text: This feels like a cheap keyboard and it's hard to not keep hitting cap lock button for me. I will have to adjust to it. No where near as nice as my last Microsoft keyboard but that was twice the price but broke in 6 months. Sigh. I can't seem to find a good USB keyboard that can last. Last two I bought only lasted 6 months. :( Not likely the feeling of this one at all. Will see if I can return and buy the previous one which has a much nicer feel.
customer_reviews.author: K. P. Bos

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely perfect, and I'm fairly picky.
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a perfect keyboard. Exactly the key layout you would want, keys feel really good under the fingers with nice, responsive action on them. It truly is one of the quieter keyboards I've used, and frankly that wasn't really one of my "must-have" features. The full-size mouse is great, fills out the palm well, quality construction and material. And to top it off, it looks great. Very sleek, all black, low profile, very well made. I'm usually pretty skeptical of Microsoft products, but I am more than impressed with this. Would recommend to anyone looking for a solid wireless mouse and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael.JD

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy (Or use at own risk)
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine but the construction is poor, the transceiver it extremely flimsy and Microsoft refuses to offer a replacement transceiver for the product, or replace the product when the way they put the transceiver together is the reason it has failed/broken. I had the product for 2 months, the glue that holds the electronics into the plastic casing of the receiver separated and caused the transceiver to stop relaying signals between the computer and the keyboard/mouse. Definitely go with the Logitech options, at least they have replacement transceivers.
customer_reviews.author: J Dell

customer_reviews.title: Great budget keyboard with decent mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 10 year old daughters first PC. I have been using the entire setup at my work for a week or so. The keyboard is great. Some of the keys are a little different from what I am used to but it's a great budget keyboard. It's quiet with nice sleek simple design. The mouse is OK. I'm not sure if it's the weight with 2xAA batteries or the "pads" on the bottom that I don't like. It does work fine it's just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: justchil

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a wired set. I have had a Microsoft wired mouse in the past and was happy so I was hoping it would be the same with this set. Absolutely happy with this combo. As other reviews mentioned, the keyboard has a slightly different feel to the keys but is very solid and comfortable to use. The mouse has a good weight to it and seems solidly built. I have had zero issues with the set and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: Not working right, after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I expected better on this keyboard, but it has quit working after 2 1/2 months. I tried the batteries, and figured out I just got a bad product with the cursor jumping all over when I try to use it, and only some of the keys on the KB work, and not all the time. It was pretty cheap so, it's kind of disposable. It also helped me decide I don't like the chiclet style keyboard, either
customer_reviews.author: Cruzer

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft paired mouse and keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Several features impressed me with this purchase: 1. Compact keyboard--although full functioning, it does not have superfluous keys that are infrequently used. 2. Positive tactile feel to keys as they are actuated. 3. My Acer Chromebox instantly picked up the new software/hardware addition without missing a beat. 4. Priced right. In fact, I bought a second keyboard/mouse set for another home computer. Both operate flawlessly. You can't go wrong with purchasing this combo MS keyboard and mouse, if it fits your individual needs.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: After less than one year, mouse wheel sticks
customer_reviews.text: I've been going nuts trying to use my mouse until I realized the wheel is sticking. It happened slowly over time and I've had the keyboard/mouse for slightly over a year. Amazon only allows me to write a review or archive the order after a year so all I can do is complain and buy a new system that definitely won't be Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Radheshwar

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mac latest version
customer_reviews.text: The product states that it only works with certain release versions of Mac operating system. It is working with latest Mac version (not listed in product description). It is pretty quiet, but still had some noise. Some of the buttons are not responding to a light touch...I have to press harder on the key...but I feel like its still a good deal. The only "quieter" keyboard on the market (apple magic) is 3x the price...
customer_reviews.author: Catie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working properly after 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: I liked the keyboard itself. The keys are quiet and the keyboard as a whole is very streamlined. Unfortunately, only 2 hours after receiving the delivery and plugging it in, the keyboard and mouse started cutting out for a couple seconds at a time every few minutes. About 30 minutes later they cut out all together and I would have to unplug and re plug the USB adapter every time.
customer_reviews.author: thefishman84

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Keyboard / Mouse Combo
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wireless keyboard / mouse combo. It is very responsive and has not had any lag issues. The mouse is very responsive. It's very good to have for this "work from home" set up with the COVID quarantine going on. Some of the functions on the laptop keyboard do not work through the VPN, but the function keys on this keyboard work properly. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Umsawasdi

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of this set for a long time. Needed a nice wireless set for my new smart TV thinking the keyboard would help a ton when having to type anything... turns out I was way wrong. Instead, I use it as a second keyboard/mouse for my PC which I have connected to the TV for when I want to play games or stream stuff via PC. I love the look of this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: DanaDark

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly nice fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of a MS clone of a Mac keyboard but this one is a very nice look and feel, with quiet but nice, tactile key presses. The companion mouse is regular size and feels comfortable for long use. My only tiny gripe is the USB dongle that seems bigger than others in its class. It sticks out like a half inch past the outside of the port and I'm scared I'm going to accidentally hit it and snap it in half. Not bad enough to lose a star though--great combo for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard / Mouse Combo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wireless keyboard / mouse combo to replace another that just felt cheap and noisy. This combo from Microsoft provides the best tactile feedback in a low-profile, low noise keyboard. And the mouse is sized nicely and feels solid. I will be buying two more of these wireless keyboard / mouse combos to replace some aging keyboard / mouse combos I still have in use.
customer_reviews.author: HD_Rider

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I love how lightly I can type, the keyboard is very responsive. The mouse is super heavy, I was surprised. I don't use it, I use my old one, it's much lighter. The mouse was responsive, just too heavy. I should say that I type on an adjustable keyboard tray. I have it sitting in my lap and tilted down/away from me. So the heavy mouse kept sliding off the mouse pad. The keyboard is great!! So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard feel and a great mouse
customer_reviews.text: Quiet keyboard, two-way adjustable and good feel to the keys. The mouse is perfect for my hand has a weighty feel to it which, to me, helps it move smoothly. Only criticism I have is the hard time opening the battery well on the keyboard. I haven't found a way to do it easily. Apparently, it should pop off with some pressure, but it took a knife edge to break it loose for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, aside from momentary disconnection
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the most part. Hate that it tends to disconnect and reconnect from my system every now and then. It usually takes a few seconds, but it's not a huge issue in the long run. Wish the keyboard had an off switch like the mouse does when its not in use since i tend to switch keyboards. Also would love it more if there was a light indicator for the caps lock.
customer_reviews.author: M Ing

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless keyboard and mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: 2 big problems: 1. There's no light on the caps lock key, so you don't know if caps lock is on. 2. There's no fn button, instead there's 2 windows keys. Why does that make sense??? It works well and I like that there's just the one usb piece for both the mouse and the keyboard. The keyboard is fairly quiet, but the mouse isn't much quieter than my old mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Been using this keyboard, mouse combo for almost 3 years with heavy usage at work. I think I may have only changed the batteries on the keyboard once and the mouse a couple of times a year. The letters on the keys are barely rubbing off but I'd figured ware n tear would eventually happen over time. Its easy to install, good size for your average desk, wireless is awesome for those who hate cable managing, average mouse All pros, no cons. Would highly recommend it to anyone for basic use. Not so much for gaming but hey what the hell if you kick ass with it the go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good kit. Full size, quiet, responsive, comfortable keyboard. The mouse is just ok and clicks are a bit on a noisier side. Hence dropped star. This is a typical wireless keyboard you'll find in your office. Nothing fancy, but no issues either.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless keyboard and mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: This combo of wireless keyboard and mouse is a nice product. The keyboard is smaller than others, and works well. I bought a combo of keyboard and mouse of another maker, that keyboard only worked for two months. I had to buy this MS product. The keyboard is quiet when I type some text. I like the combo very much.
customer_reviews.author: Bing Zhu

customer_reviews.title: No Caps Lock or Numeric Lock indicator
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad keyboard, types just fine. Mouse is fine. I am though, very disappointed that there is no Caps Lock / Num Lock indicator either LED or screen message. When I read specs and features it didn't mention that there was or was not this feature. I thought that a mid level Microsoft product would naturally have such. My fault for ordering before confirming feature was not include. I haven't had it long enough to comment on battery live. I will say keyboard battery compartment is difficult to open on my product. You have to use much more force than I feel comfortable using in order not to damage the cover.
customer_reviews.author: johnny in the usa

customer_reviews.title: Lags.  A lot.
customer_reviews.text: Honeslty. Really unhappy with my purchase. And, that was a pretty big surprised since the Microsoft brand on hardware has always been synonymous with quality. I've never used a wireless keyboard that lags more than this one. It is almost unusable. I moved it from my desk to the conference room and have heard nothing but complaints from my employees. It is just a terribly frustrating combo. Most likely will replace soon - any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fogleman

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this replacement for Logitech Mk520
customer_reviews.text: Replaced Logitech Mk520 and so far happy with the keyboard. Concerns about having to adjust from Logitech's taller keys proved to not be an issue. It does not look like this keyboard will have its labels come off after a few months of use which was the primary reason for trying something other than Logitech. Unacceptable on Logitech'a part. The mouse however is a different subject. It is not bad but definitely not on par with Logitech M510. In fairness, M510 is a more premium product.
customer_reviews.author: Gennady Gandelman

customer_reviews.title: Works well, as discribed, no more cords
customer_reviews.text: Having an illuminated keyboard would be nice for those late nights, but would sacrifice battery life. On that note, rechargeable power supply would be a good addition. As for the things in the box, just as discribed. I had to take the batteries out of the keyboard initially to get it to pair up, but beyond that, no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: skooch

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, except bluetooth cuts out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few weeks back outfitting the home office for work from home. Works great, just plug in the bluetooth dongle and it just works.... except every couple hours it decides to lose connectivity. Unplug the dongle and plug it back in and it works fine for a couple of hours. 2 stars because this is getting annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Maher

customer_reviews.title: Key feeling, dongle size and mouse quality
customer_reviews.text: It is very personal, but the keys in the keyboard are a little hard. I was sometimes skipping to hit a key, because I didn't put pressure enough while typing. It is a very different feeling than a standard low profile key like in most of the laptops. The USB dongle is more or less the double of a regular one. The mouse is bad, the corners of the buttons hit each other depending on how you hit them. In summary, very frustrating product, since I was expecting a high quality from a Microsoft product.
customer_reviews.author: Danilo Martins

customer_reviews.title: Keys stick
customer_reviews.text: Keys stick causing all kinds of issues. At one point the delete key stuck and deleted and entire menu in my system at work. It's too bad because I like the way this one feels and the keys are silent. I unfortunately didn't go back into the office until after the 30 day return window so I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: JJohns

customer_reviews.title: Non-standard keyboard spacing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard on the hope that it would be a good, standard, keyboard, with all the proper keys for Windows. Quality of the keyboard seems fine - but the key spacing is tight. I touch type and I find that these keys are closer together than a normal keyboard. For a desktop there is no need to worry about saving 2 inches and jam all the keys closer together. I'll give it the rest of the day - but this is likely going back.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tremblay

customer_reviews.title: Mouse randomly switches to the previous web page
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a chiclet keyboard and this item delivers it. I am not happy with the mouse, though. Often when browsing websites, when I move the mouse to the left, the browser occasionally reverts to the previous page, as if I had clicked the "back" button. Is this a bug or a feature? Also, the mouse wheel doesn't rotate smoothly. Finally, the USB receiver (dongle?) sticks out a lot more than the Logitech products do. I fear that if I toss the laptop in its case too carelessly, the USB receiver might break off.
customer_reviews.author: JonathanL

customer_reviews.title: As quiet as any keyboard I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * Quiet * Great value for money * Visually appealing Cons: * I wish the 'Enter' key were larger It's a great keyboard and mouse combo and I wholly recommend it - especially if you have a Microsoft Surface Pro (mine is version 6).
customer_reviews.author: B.M.

customer_reviews.title: NO HELP
customer_reviews.text: THERE WAS NO WAY THAT YOU COULD TELL IF CAPS WERE ON.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Issues started after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard and mouse combo because I liked the feel of the keyboard, the mouse was nicely sized, the communication was encrypted, and I could eliminate cables on my desk. However, after only 2 months the mouse began to lag meaning I would move the mouse but the cursor on the screen wouldn't move in sync. Using a computer with a mouse that doesn't move the cursor as it should is quite possibly the most frustrating experience. I do not recommend buying this product. The quality is not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: RTPnomad

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft wireless keypad and mouse.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked to perfection. My first purchase was 2 months before and the mouse stopped functioning. Because I had it for over a month, I was unable to have it replaced. So I went with a new set that is name brand. It cost less and I am much happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Grandmama

customer_reviews.title: Turned out very good!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was concerned when I read some of the reviews mentioning the lag and overall quality. However, so far I haven't experienced any of those issues. The keys feel great and there is no lag when I use it for regular tasks. At this price range I think it doesn't get better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice combo for the money - mouse is nice and chunky
customer_reviews.text: Very nice combo set. The mouse is bigger than I expected - nice and chunky, which I very much appreciate working at a desk all day - and the keyboard gives decent feedback and travel. My only complaint is that there is no OFF switch on the keyboard, but there is on the mouse. Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: rav4ger

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year and 10 months - MS makes it super difficult to file a warranty claims
customer_reviews.text: The USB adapter failed and even prevented my computer from starting after 1 year and 10 months of in-office use. Theoretically there is a 2 or 3 year warranty on this device but Microsoft makes it impossible to register the device through my Microsoft account to get service. Can't get service through the Amazon website either. It says that the service window has passed.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks and functions perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use an a "free to m" Imac that didn't come with any peripherals. It came fast and connected up right out of the box with no issues. Works as well as a wired keyboard, even when waking up the machine. Both the mouse and keyboard connect to the same dongle, so only one USB port gets taken up! So far, no issues with connectivity or battery life at all, and these two look real nice sitting on my desk!
customer_reviews.author: TazandSteve

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is tight
customer_reviews.text: I seem to not have enough space for a-z section, too much for arrows, not used to having numbers - had one long ago. Thought I’d like it but just takes up too much space. Bluetooth works fine for both keyboard and mouse. Will probably replace keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Denise ABC

customer_reviews.title: Wireless keyboard and mouse connects to computer with single USB dongle
customer_reviews.text: This works fine to connect a wireless keyboard and mouse to the computer with a single USB dongle. It is not Bluetooth. The mouse uses two AA batteries and has an on/off switch. The keyboard uses two AAA batteries and does not have an on/off switch. A charger is not provided. Even though no on/off switch is provided on the keyboard, good battery life is still accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cordless Keyboard and mouse that work most of the time...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard and mouse works most of the time, but does usually lose connection everyday at some point in time. You just have to pull the usb plug in out and place it in another usb port. It is kind of annoying, but is not the end of the world. If this a deal breaker for you, then don't buy it. Other than that, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Dorito

customer_reviews.title: If you lose/break the USB receiver (dongle), you cannot replace it, and thus the keyboard/mouse will not longer work.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse work well. They are comfortable to use and I would recommend them as a matter of hardware. Unfortunately, I lost my USB receiver (dongle) and they do not separately sell these, so my only option is to buy a new keyboard/mouse. This is fairly frustrating since not only do I have to purchase a new set, but I also have to get rid of a perfectly good set (aside from this missing dongle). Since now I need to get a new set, I will not be buying the Microsoft product again in case the dongle breaks/gets misplaced/stops working in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brant Baber

customer_reviews.title: Simple, even elegant, looking combo!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless keyboard and mouse combo that would look good on an espresso colored desk. I wanted something that was a full keyboard with minimal design. Pleasantly happy with these! The keys are soft and quiet and have pretty decent travel to them. Even the mouse is on the minimalist side with only a subtle embossed microsoft logo near the wheel. The only thing that i "don't like" about this is that none of the keys are backlit but thats ok since my monitor gives enough light for me to see the keys anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard, good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm quite happy with this keyboard- especially the key feel and the obvious fact that it's wireless. A few niggles have me withholding one of my stars: 1. My old keyboard had a larger delete key whereas this one is the same size as all of the "letter" keys. 2. There is no caps lock or num lock light. I don't know why keyboards even have a caps lock button anymore- I might glue mine so it can't be used. If you can live with these issues I think it's a sold buy.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but noisy. Not typist friendly
customer_reviews.text: After searching online reviews for a quiet keyboard, I purchased this. It’s not very quiet. The keys have a slight texture that makes it a little quieter than a basic keyboard. However, that texture makes typing difficult. Your fingers don’t glide across the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Leisa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I simply LOVE the design and overall look of this mouse-keyboard set. I wanted a minimalist set to use on my personal desktop. Battery life is amazing, I use it every day for more than 17hrs and it's been months and still no signs of needing to replace the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Priss

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my server at home with little thought but have been pleasantly surprised. The mouse feels solid and is smooth in operation. The keyboard is also solid and well built. To be honest. I actually like this set a little better than the Logitech mouse & keyboard that I bought for my super gaming machine at a higher price. I might just swap them out. Great set for a great price IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: A nice, quiet keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft has always made good peripherals, and this is no exception. I bought this to replace my AmazonBasics wireless keyboard and mouse combo, which while OK, made very loud noises when I typed quickly. As someone who likes typing on laptop-style chicklet keyboards, this keyboard is amazing and much quieter. I haven't noticed any lag, which was noticeable with the AmazonBasics keyboard. I took a 5-minute typing test with this keyboard and was able to type at 98 WPM without any lag or missed key presses, another issue that could happen with my previous keyboard when the receiver was too far away. I might have to buy another one for work...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Howe

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.  Mouse feels cheap though.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this combo, just for the keyboard as it was cheaper in a combo. Keyboard works great. Has a great feel to the keys and isn't noisy when you are typing. I don't notice any delay in what I am typing. Keyboard is 5 stars. Not one complaint. Seems very durable and high quality. I didn't like the feel of the mouse that came with it. Very light way and didn't feel very durable, so I kept my logitch wireless moue. I have noticed a slight stutter on occasion using my logitch mouse with this keyboard. It isn't bad though and doesn't stop me from using it. I would still recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Brad P

customer_reviews.title: Only got 8 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Return key started sticking and the scroll wheel on the mouse stopped working. I liked the keyboard layout and feel, but was never really a fan of the mouse. It is a fat heavy mouse. I would not purchase this combo again. Back to Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Similar to MacBook Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to connect to my laptop and to mimic the keyboard on my MacBook. I like the button spacing and they keyboard is pretty quiet - though not as quiet as my MacBook keyboard for some reason. The dongle that attaches to your computer is a little large, and the only con is that the mouse does not automatically turn off. There is a compartment beneath the mouse to hide the dongle but it is a little annoying to have to pop off the lid each time as this is also where the batteries go.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet keyboard (not mouse)
customer_reviews.text: First, I really don't like microsoft, but comparing this keyboard against the others on the market it is the quietest AND affordable. The mouse is not quiet so I only use the keyboard with another super quiet mouse. The price is worth the peace.
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Rubber on mouse wheel just slips
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft has consistently delivered really good keyboards and mice in the past, but this mouse is terrible. The rubber on the scroll wheel just slides over the wheel when you scroll, so you are moving the wheel but the scrolls aren't registered because you are only moving the rubber. Terrible mouse. Keyboard isn't bad. Not a lot of travel, but that's what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kubel

customer_reviews.title: Works well but keyboard does not turn off, goes through batteries
customer_reviews.text: The price was great, the pairing was perfect, glad to see an on/off switch for the mouse, but the keyboard lacks this function. You can not turn the keyboard off... or if there is a way it is not known to me nor in the manual. The keyboard is quiet and the keys have a great satisfying feel, but I am going through batteries quickly for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great silent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was on the lookout for a keyboard that was both sleek and silent, but was made of great build quality. This keyboard matched all of that criteria for me. I love this keyboard. It's so quiet and typing feels pretty good on it. It's ergonomic enough for me and the mouse that came with it is pretty good as well. I'm using a different mouse instead though, but I wouldn't mind using this mouse if I need a backup. Plus, for this price, I don't think you can go wrong. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: David Adams

customer_reviews.title: Typing experience absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is incredibly difficult to type on. They keys are very difficult to press and have a large amount of friction. This is an extremely poorly designed keyboard that is easily out-done by keyboards one fourth the price. Buy an amazon basic keyboard for 14 dollars and save yourself some pain.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuyOnTheInternet

customer_reviews.title: Great quality keyboard with low noise level
customer_reviews.text: Bought because I am on more video calls these days and need a quieter keyboard for taking notes during the meeting. Easy to install, recognized by Windows OS right away. The key clicks are very quiet along with the mouse button and scroll wheel. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E

customer_reviews.title: Very nice desktop set!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wireless desktop! I like the chicklet style keyboard keys, and both the keyboard and mouse seem to have a power management, standby mode. So the battery seems to last a good long while!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: I've had the mouse + keyboard for a few weeks now and at first it worked great - the keyboard is quiet and the mouse fits nicely in your hand. However, the mouse routinely stops working. It's not a battery issue i think it's an issue with it connecting to my laptop. This would easily get 5 stars but for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: DaveO

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, stops working in less than a year with 2 different sets
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this mouse and keyboard on April 7, 2017 and it work great for 11 months, after which the mouse started cutting out and I started loosing keystrokes. I really liked the feel of both the keyboard and mouse, so I purchased a replacement on March 15, 2018 and the same thing started happening in January 2019. Replacing the batteries didn't help, so I think this is just a case of bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Wexler

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best keyboard and mouse bundle
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for: a simple sleek keyboard with a great full size mouse that works as expected. I like the fact that it doesn't have unnecessary details and a crazy design with a lot of buttons and all of that junk... the only thing that I don't like so far is that there's no indicator light for the CAPS key, everything else is great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bautista

customer_reviews.title: o caps lock indicator
customer_reviews.text: Caps lock is displayed for a short time on the screen but there is no caps lock light on the keyboard. I buy it because the mouse has a wheel button double click function I really like. .
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: a solid set
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Unlike those Chinese brands very popular here, this keyboard does not require a throw-away keystroke to wake up which is super annoying because you don't know if your first keystroke after some period of inactivity will be registered or not. I only wish the mouse came with at least a back button for easier web browsing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in SJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. A little difficult to get used to since you type on the left side instead on the middle, but happy with it overall. The mouse is nothing special so I connected a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: A plain, no-frills, good working keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is solid for generic use. There is not a bunch of extra features and buttons to do quick short cuts like other keyboards that I have. But if you need a regular keyboard to just get the job done and don't want any cords/wires, this is the keyboard for you. The lack of extra features is why I only gave a four star review instead of a five star review. Other than that it would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: JayZ

customer_reviews.title: Key delay/lag & keys get stuck.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard looks nice but doesn't function well. If you stop using the keyboard for more than 5 seconds it will go into sleep mode so when you go back to type it'll omit the first button you press. The keys also stick. The ones I noticed the most are backspace and arrow keys. They'll constantly repeat and ruin whatever it is you're trying to type. I wouldn't suggest this as a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Seki

customer_reviews.title: Latest Model Much Better Design
customer_reviews.text: Last years model was a finger print magnet, the keys were less responsive and the mouse felt cheap. This years model is a harder plastic, the mate finish on everything means no finger prints and the mouse has some nice weight to it for plastic. The keys are a little too hard to press for the small distance required to click (less clicky).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lamm

customer_reviews.title: Keys Constantly Stick
customer_reviews.text: It's extremely rare I leave product reviews. I purchased this unit specifically for the keyboard and I would advise looking elsewhere for a functioning keyboard. Keys are constantly getting stuck in the "pressed" position. After only a few months, this product is unbearable to work with. I have been extremely gentle with the keyboard and it has sat at my desk the entire time.... Look elsewhere for a keyboard solution! I am now stuck with a keyboard and mouse that can't be returned and can't be used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is most comfortable keyboard I've had in while. The keys are nice a quiet and provide good travel and speed. I wish certain fruit based computer makers had keyboards like this.
customer_reviews.author: BXCOBB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, strong connection, gamer worthy, long-lasting battery
customer_reviews.text: I use it for treadmill desk work, wireless gaming with my Steam Link in the living room, and other applications. Fantastic long-lasting batter with solid performance.
customer_reviews.author: JShel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice feel, matte finish, very low latency
customer_reviews.text: I hate bluetooth mice/keyboards. This works great with my iPad Pro (with an adapter), PC, and MacBook Pro (also with an adapter). The matte finish is great and highly preferred.
customer_reviews.author: basillover372

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is fine but the mouse is worthless. Scroll wheel has too firm resistance to turning that is non adjustable. More often than not you end up triggering a center button click while pushing the wheel firmly enough to overcome the resistance to rotation for scrolling. Not good...
customer_reviews.author: Tachyon

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard for the Price...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good keyboard for the price however I returned it to buy another HP Elite Keyboard v2, as I really prefer the feel and extra features of it, even though it's more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old wired keyboard and opted for a wireless one. I am a keyboard lover, i.e. I love the feel and hand movements when I use a keyboard. This one is very comfortable and my hands are right at home. As for material quality, it seems about average for keyboards nowadays. I cannot attest to the battery life or durability as I've only had it a few weeks. But if you love to use a keyboard, this one is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard, mouse is pretty decent too and both are good looking. Only complaint is the mouse is a little on the smaller side. I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CMore

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard arrived on time as scheduled and I love it. It is the most quiet keyboard I have ever worked on. The keys have good 'bounce' and feel good while typing even for an extended period. It is of quality construction and should be very durable. It fully deserves 5 stars for all of the previous reasons. Thanks Microsoft and Amazon for selling a quality product. Another satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace a damaged one my company had bought and it worked right out of the box with no setup and Duracell batteries. I couldn't ask for more. The mouse is a nice size and feels not to flat or hard to pick up and reposition.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard and mouse, Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard and mouse set to work from and I love it. The keyboard design is minimal and the keys give nice feedback. It also seems to get less fingerprints than the 850 series. It’s a bit pricey but worth its pricey uses one usb dongle to connect the keyboard and mouse. Batteries are included.
customer_reviews.author: mike ochoa

customer_reviews.title: My go to Wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless keyboard and mouse I have used. Some may not love the lack of clicking with the keys but I love it! It is so quiet and the keys feel almost soft as I type. My kind of keyboard. It's a lot flatter than a old wired keyboard, more like a laptop style but I am used to that type so it didn't bother me at all. Mouse is great too, nothing special but works well. The dongle that plus in the computer's USB is tiny and not noticeable or obtrusive. Will buy again for future computers when needed.
customer_reviews.author: DM3

customer_reviews.title: Bad Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is build on 2.4 GHz standard as are all wireless USB keyboard. Bluetooth 3.0 also uses 2.4 GHz so you get interference. If you try to use this keyboard from a USB hub (as I have set up on my surface) you will get interference. It will not work from more than a foot away. I will be returning this and looking for another option. I like the clean design and quiet keys, but the wireless technology is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Microsoft Wireless Desktop 900 (PT3-00001),Black
product_meta.description: This simple, modern desktop set provides security with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) to protect your keystrokes, and a full-size mouse that provides comfortable, precise navigation. Both the keyboard and the mouse have an average battery life of 2-years and each provide easy access to Windows features to keep you productive and efficient.
feature_bullets: Full-size mouse provides comfortable, precise navigation
Quiet-touch keys provide comfortable, responsive typing
Ambidextrous design is great for use in either hand
Hot keys provide easy-access to commonly used functions
Customizable buttons give you access to the Windows features you use most
2 AAA and 2 AA alkaline batteries required (trial batteries included, best with Polaroid batteries)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,115 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
